name: Span
comment: A simple class that describe a segment of source text.

end.name: end
end.comment: The end location of this span, exclusive.

sourceUrl.name: sourceUrl
sourceUrl.comment: Url of the source (typically a file) containing this span.

length.name: length
length.comment: The length of this span, in characters.

text.name: text
text.comment: The source text for this span, if available.

formatLocation.name: formatLocation
formatLocation.comment: Gets the location in standard printed form filename:line:column, where line and column are adjusted by 1 to match the convention in editors.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

union.name: union
union.comment: Creates a new span that is the union of two existing spans source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.Span-union.start and source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.Span-union.end. Note that the resulting span might contain some positions that were not in either of the original spans if source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.Span-union.start and source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.Span-union.end are disjoint.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

compareTo.name: compareTo
compareTo.comment: Compares two spans. If the spans are not in the same source, this method generates an error.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

compareTo.name: compareTo
compareTo.comment:
Compares this object to another dart-core.Comparable

Returns a value like a dart-core.Comparator when comparing this to source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.compareTo.other. That is, it returns a negative integer if this is ordered before source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.compareTo.other, a positive integer if this is ordered after source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.compareTo.other, and zero if this and source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.compareTo.other are ordered together.

The source_maps/source_maps-span.Span.compareTo.other argument must be a value that is comparable to this object.
